bboxes.raw_text:
Each year, more people are
doing everything from refinish-
ing a chair to building complete
house themselves. Unfortunate
ly, many enter a do-it-yourself
project with lot of enthusiasm
but not enough preparation. Re-
suit: injuries ranging from sliv-
ers to broken bones. In an effort
to reduce causes of accidents,
the Sentry Safety Council Of
Hardware Mutuals-Sentry Life
insurance group has compiled
these do-it-yourself safety tips:
. Never wear long -sleeved shirts,


gloves, wrist watches or rings


when operating power tools.
Be sure hands are dry and you


are standing on dry floor be-


fore turning on power.


Electrical circuit of shop


should be separate from house,


adequate to carry volt-load.


Rubber floor mats reduce


shock and slipping hazards.
. When adjusting a machine,


turn off power and wait until


it has come to a standstill.


Never use hands to slow down


a machine warns the Sentry


Safety Council.


. Wear safety glasses when US


ing lathe, similar machines.
. Electric saws should have


guards, feather boards and


kick back pawls. Use a pusher


stick when ripping short


boards. Do not reach over


blade while saw is in operation.
. Keep tools sharp.


. When using a screwdriver, do


not hold work in the palm of


your hand.


. Point tools away from body;


never carry tools in pockets.
. Do not smoke in a workshop;


provide a fireproof container


for saw dust; keep a fire ex-


tinguisher nearby.


Finally, the Sentry Safety
Council says a little precaution
ahead Of time can make first aid
measures unnecessary later.

Sentry Sentry g.:
Safety -
Council TX

Last spring my husband and |
decided we would refurnish the
bedroom. We discussed new
colors and new types of mater
ials for draperies. We looked
at many furniture advertisements
and window arrangements.


A week before Christmas we
decided to purchase a walnut
bedroom set with a king size bed.
The next few days brought COM
plete change of practically every
thing. The king size bed was real
ly an oversize king size. The mat
tress we had ordered was too
small. 1t was several days before
the correct one was delivered.


On the first evening after the
bedroom furniture was delivered
Il received the shock of my life
| found had forgotten to buy
any king size bed linens. | dashed
to the telephone and called sew
eral stores. Only one store had
the oversize king size sheets l
wanted.


A few minutes before closing
time rushed in the store and
ordered two sheets. While look
Ing around, remembered that |
would need a king size blanket,
too.


The next day | returned and
purchased three more sets of
sheets, two sets of pillowcases,
two large pillows and ordered
a king size mattress cover.


The king size bedspread my
Mother sent US last year came in
handy. We will have to find an
diversified one after our new drap-
cries are finished and hung.


You can buy some new fur
niture, but 1t will cause you to
always get something else new.
A new broom may sweep clean
lit will sweep a new rug even
cleaner.


The new bed was the starting
point of decorating the entire
bedroom and buying new linens,
draperies and throw rugs. This
is not a bad investment how
ever. since researchers say we
spend approximately two thirds of
our lives In bed.

Last week the new mayor and city council
members of Phoenix took office. Mayor MI
tom Graham and council members, Mrs. K1ztg-
lick, Dr.. Pisano, MessYs. Hyde, L0ney, Lind
neY and Jarvis Will haze many old and neW
problems to solUe.


Mayor Graham presented his views Of the
most pressing problems in his initial speech.
He stated that the police department needs
more officers and a dog leash Ian sOas needed


These t1OO problems are very pressing and
action should be taken at once. The city street
program needs further consideration. Free
nays are needed but main thOY0ughtayeS are
also COmgeSted.


A new police chief has been selected. Chief
Paul Bh4n1bouxu'S record in the city police
department assures us that he min be an
able man and he Vil help Improve the
entire department.


AS the nesV city government and police
ad,,sinistyatto begins ne hope that Phoenix
viii outdistance its oun re cord of growth
in the next year. We can not leaUe everything
ub to the neV mayor, council members nor
the police chief, ne the citizens are Yesbon-
Sible, too.
